Description: Mould-made pottery plastic lamp in the form of an African's head, with a tubular splayed nozzle projecting from the mouth. The filling-hole is pierced through the top of the head, and is edged by a plain rim. The tapering handle is decorated with a palmette. The base is damaged; the oval base-ring is defined by a groove. Covered with a bright orange slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q752)
